articles.author: Deborah Byrd
articles.title: How soon after new moon can you see the young moon? - EarthSky
articles.description: You have an excellent chance to spot a moon less than 24 hours old in April. For most of North America, new moon in April is on the 11th before midnight. Therefore, on April 12 at sunset, as soon as the sun slips below the horizon, the race begins to spot a y…
articles.content: Not many people have seen a moon within a day of new phase, and if you haven’t either, you get a great opportunity to do so on April 12, 2021. Some will be able to see the moon with just their eyes, … [+6196 chars]
